nameEntry.part: Berry Street - Child and Family Care

biogHist.abstract: Berry Street - Child and Family Care was the new name given in 1975 to the former Berry Street Babies' Home and Hospital. The name change reflected Berry Street's new focus on child care, family counselling and support, and residential care for children in family group homes. In 1992, the name changed again to Berry Street Incorporated.
biogHist.p: Berry Street - Child and Family Care came into being in 1975. It was previously known as the Berry Street Babies' Home and Hospital.
The name change reflected Berry Street's new focus on child care, family counselling and support, and residential care for children in family group homes, one of which was in St Kilda in 1979.

Berry Street celebrated its centenary in 1977. The centenary year was marked by the completion of a rebuilding and development program. This included the building of two 'modern homes' providing emergency accommodation for families, a new administration building and a two-storey wooden cubby house, built as a gift by students at RMIT for the children at Berry Street.
The Patroness of Berry Street, Lady Winneke, opened the new facilities on 9 November 1976.
In March 1977, the Past Nurses Association held a centenary celebration of its own, with a lunch at the Hilton Hotel.
The official centenary celebrations for Berry Street took the form of a 'basket luncheon' with 500 guests on 15 June 1977.
In 1992, the name changed again to Berry Street Incorporated.
Berry Street Victoria is the custodian of records from Berry Street Child and Family Care.

chronItem.event: Location - Berry Street - Child and Family Care was located in Berry Street, East Melbourne

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Berry Street Babies' Home and Hospital (1964 - 1975)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1975, Berry Street Babies' Home and Hospital changed its name to Berry Street - Child and Family Care.

In around 1997 the Social Welfare Department asked Berry Street Child and Family Care to establish a family group home in Richmond to house children affected by the closure of St Cuthbert's Children's Home Colac.
In 1992, Berry Street - Child and Family Care changed its name to Berry Street Incorporated.

archref.unittitle: Advice of admission of a child to an institution and claim for additional child endowment
archref.abstract: This is a copy of a form used by the Commonwealth Department of Social Services in the 1970s to administer child endowment payments to institutions. This form was provided to the Find & Connect web resource by Berry Street's Heritage and Background Information Service and has been redacted to protect the privacy of individuals.
